body:
The `org.eclipse.angus.activation.nativeimage.AngusActivationFeature` feature (any GraalVM feature) is supposed to only be used during build-time and not end up in the native image. For some reason this one ends up being referenced by a heap object. 

It looks like it has been reported before in https://github.com/quarkiverse/quarkus-cxf/issues/944

Looking...

Sharing some first results:

The type seems to become reachable through:

```
parsing method org.hibernate.validator.internal.metadata.PredefinedScopeBeanMetaDataManager.clear(PredefinedScopeBeanMetaDataManager.java:124) reachable via the parsing context
    at org.hibernate.validator.internal.engine.PredefinedScopeValidatorFactoryImpl.close(PredefinedScopeValidatorFactoryImpl.java:294)
    at io.quarkus.hibernate.validator.runtime.HibernateValidatorRecorder$2$1.run(HibernateValidatorRecorder.java:197)
    at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil$LinkedRunnable.run(IOUtil.java:526)
    at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.releaseScopes(IOUtil.java:515)
    at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.write(IOUtil.java:251)
    at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.write(SocketChannelImpl.java:578)
    at io.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioSocketChannel.doWrite(NioSocketChannel.java:429)
    at io.netty.channel.AbstractChannel$AbstractUnsafe.flush0(AbstractChannel.java:929)
    at io.netty.channel.nio.AbstractNioChannel$AbstractNioUnsafe.flush0(AbstractNioChannel.java:359)
    at io.netty.channel.nio.AbstractNioByteChannel$1.run(AbstractNioByteChannel.java:54)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1144)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:642)
    at java.lang.Thread.runWith(Thread.java:1596)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
    at jdk.internal.misc.InnocuousThread.run(InnocuousThread.java:186)
    at com.oracle.svm.core.thread.PlatformThreads.threadStartRoutine(PlatformThreads.java:896)
    at com.oracle.svm.core.thread.PlatformThreads.threadStartRoutine(PlatformThreads.java:872)
    at com.oracle.svm.core.code.IsolateEnterStub.PlatformThreads_threadStartRoutine_7ca06a92d37709d55cf0945cbea8bdcde7f70f0e(generated:0)
    at static root method.(Unknown Source)
```

and the reachable type appears to be a bean class named `org.eclipse.angus.activation.nativeimage.AngusActivationFeature$1`

so my so far understanding (which might not be that good) is that hibernate validator is injecting a bean to the `AngusActivationFeature` class, while it shouldn't. I have no idea why it stops happening when `quarkus-mongodb-client` is not present.

@gsmet is there any way to control (or just log) which classes hibernate validator injects beans to?

Hey, 
I noticed it's about validation, so here I am ðŸ˜„ 
```java
    @Valid // commenting this made the build succeed
    private List<TestData2> fields;
```

this is a pre Bean Validation 2.0 way of defining the constraint... starting with 2.0 the recommended way to do this is to place the `@Valid` at the type argument:

```java
    private List<@Valid TestData2> fields;
```
^ will result in list elements validated and better performance/behavior for the validator itself. 
Just tested this change on the reporodcuer and all seems to be fine.


Now, as to why it's failing ... I'm speculating here, but `AngusActivationFeature` contains the following line:

```
private static final List<String> RESOURCES = new ArrayList<String>() {{ add("META-INF/mailcap"); add("META-INF/mailcap.default");}} ;
```
so when we look for possible impls of `List` (to see if cascading validation has to apply to the list itself) do we discover this "type" and hence it ends up being recorded?

Good catch @marko-bekhta , indeed moving the annotation resolves the issue. 

I believe the right fix on the Quarkus side would be to exclude subclasses of `org.graalvm.nativeimage.hosted.Feature` from validation. Not sure if that should extend to other native-bits as well but I can't think of any _standard one_ at the moment.

Here's where the impls are detected:

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/46892f9d2c7b0e63f5c6057f4d7143b8e61dabc3/extensions/hibernate-validator/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/hibernate/validator/deployment/HibernateValidatorProcessor.java#L711-L728

And then that's how the index is constructed: 

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/46892f9d2c7b0e63f5c6057f4d7143b8e61dabc3/extensions/hibernate-validator/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/hibernate/validator/deployment/HibernateValidatorProcessor.java#L471-L478

> exclude subclasses of org.graalvm.nativeimage.hosted.Feature from validation

we probably could ... I'm thinking though.... should that `org.eclipse.angus.activation.nativeimage.AngusActivationFeature` be in the index in the first place? Ideally, what we want to work here in the `HibernateValidatorProcessor` is the index only of classes available at runtime, right?

> I'm thinking though.... should that `org.eclipse.angus.activation.nativeimage.AngusActivationFeature` be in the index in the first place? Ideally, what we want to work here in the `HibernateValidatorProcessor` is the index only of classes available at runtime, right?

Good point. How do we remove it from the index though? GraalVM features are tricky because although they are considered as available at "runtime" from the Quarkus perspective, they are only used during native-image compilation and are then dropped, meaning they are indeed not available at the _actual_ application runtime.
We should **not** manually be removing stuff from the index. The indexes are built using specific rules and it's the extensions that need to properly handle what is present or missing from them.

issue.title: Use List.of() instead of an anonymous class
issue.body:
This is creating issues for us in Quarkus as the anonymous class is detected by Hibernate Validator scanning, while it shouldn't.

As the anonymous class has no value here and using List.of() is better, I think it's worth creating a PR to improve this.

See https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/47033 for all the gory details.

labels.name: area/devtools

body:
I created:
- https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/angus-activation/pull/52 - which should also the issue for this particular case. We will see if it gets merged and released.
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/47152 - to ignore GraalVM features in HV scanning - but this will require some Jandex improvements
